Felix Lucka

welcome to my academic web site

About Me

  • since October 2017: Research associate at the Computational Imaging Group at the Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica, Amsterdam.
  • since September 2014: Research associate at the Center for Medical Image Computing (CMIC) at the Department of Computer Science, University College London (UCL).
  • 2013: Research visit to UCLA, Los Angeles. Invitation by Andrea Bertozzi and Stanley Osher.
  • 2011-2014 PhD student in the Working Group Imaging, Institute for Computational and Applied Mathematics, WWU Münster, by a scholarship of the German National Academic Foundation (Studienstiftung des deutschen Volkes)
  • March 2011: Diploma thesis in applied mathematics with topic "Hierarchical Bayesian Approaches to the Inverse Problem of EEG/MEG Current Density Reconstruction"
  • October 2005 - March 2011: Academic studies at the WWU (Westfälische Wilhelms-Universität) Münster. Diploma in Mathematics with minor in Physics, vordiploma in Physics with minor in Computer Science.
  • 2004: Abitur (higher education entrance qualification) obtained at the Gymnasium Mellendorf
  • Born on May 23rd, 1985 in Hannover, Germany
Short curriculum vitae (last update: March, 2017).
